about.github: The code of this project is available on {{GitHub}}.
about.summary: The TranscriptionPortal is a web-application for processing audio files using automatic and manual tools combined in one workflow ("transcription chain"). Users can select the desired mode: "Annotation" or "Translation & Summarization" for specific workflows. In Annotation mode they are able to process their audio files using ASR, Manual Transcription ({{Octra}}), Word Alignment and Phonetic Detail ({{EmuWebApp}}). If users prefer to automatically summarize and translate transcripts using AI they are able to use the "Summarization an Translation" mode.
about.title: About the TranscriptionPortal

errors.missing fields: Please fill in the required fields.

introduction.paragraph1: Each audio file was added to a separate task (and optionally one corresponding transcript). These new tasks are going to be processed one after the other. Please check if all options are set as you wish. While you are selecting the ASR provider from the list you can click on the {{iIcon}} on the right of a list entry for further information like data storage policy and terms and conditions.
introduction.paragraph2: When you click "OK" you agree with the terms and conditions of the selected (third-party) services and the files are marked for further processing. As soon as you click on the "3. START PROCESSING" button the processing of tasks starts.

asr service provider.description: ASR (Automatic Speech Recognition) is done by extern service providers. Select an ASR provider from the list. Each item on the list offers further information about the provider.
asr service provider.name: ASR Service Provider

content language.description: The spoken language for all added audio files.
content language.help: The list of supported content languages depends on the selected ASR provider.
content language.name: Content Language

options.description: Set the options for your workflow, e.g. service provider and languages. Click on the {{iIcon}} for further information. The options are going to applied on the listed tasks above.

diarization.description: Select speaker diarization if you wish to separate the transcripts for each speaker
diarization.name: Diarization

number of speakers.description: If you know the number of speakers it is recommended to set a value here.
number of speakers.name: Number of Speakers

number of words.description: Set a maximum number of words for the resulted summarization.
number of words.name: Max. number of words for summarization

summarization service provider.description: The list of supported content languages depends on the selected ASR Provider.
summarization service provider.name: Summarization Service Provider

translation language.description: The language for the summarization should be translated to.
translation language.name: Translate to

word alignment language.description: On Word Alignment step MAUS by BAS Webservices is used. For better results set a language for that step.
word alignment language.name: Word Alignment Language

tasks.asr provider requirement mismatch: One or more audio files do not fit the ASR provider's requirements:
tasks.description: Check the tasks that you want to perform.
tasks.incompatible files: Incompatible audio files are marked with a red cross on the left. These audio files are not going to be processed.
tasks.warning readding files: Please close this window and re-add the files with file names in orange to the table. Otherwise these files are going to be skipped.

downloads.introduction: This creates a zip-archive of all the selected results and optionally conversions to other formats. If you do not select any additional conversions only the original results are added to the zip-archive.
downloads.latest result: Please notice, that only the latest results are inserted to the package.
downloads.remove selected line: Remove selected lines from transcription portal (permanently)
downloads.title: Download results by {{type}}

list.closing the window: 2. After closing and re-opening this page you can only continue cancelled tasks from the last finished step.
list.do not clear app data: 4. Do not clear the browser's data for web applications
list.do not close tab: 1. Do not close this tab or browser window while processing. The processes are running only while this web application is opened. If you use this app on a laptop you need to keep the laptop opened while processing.
list.re-adding audio file: 3. Audio files are saved only for the time of processing. In some situation you could be asked to add the audio file again.

retrieving data.description: Please wait until all necessary data has been downloaded...
retrieving data.title: Retrieving data...

split audio.description: You have added audio files with two channels. In order to continue the channels will be split in separate files and each could be processed separately.
split audio.question: What would you like to do?
split audio.title: Audio files with two channels detected

processing time.description: Move the mouse over the pie chart for more information.
processing time.title: Processing duration (minutes)

annotation.description: In annotation mode the TranscriptionPortal helps you to annotate audio files using a workflow that includes automatic tools like Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) and manual tools like OCTRA (Orthographic Transcription).
annotation.name: Annotation

summarization and translation.description: If you want to know more about the content of your audio recordings this mode is the right one. Additionally to ASR it summarizes the transcript using AI and translates the result to a preferred language.
summarization and translation.name: Summarization & Translation

manual transcription.description: A literal transcript contains the verbatim text of a speech recording. These transcripts are either generated by Automatic Speech Recognition or they are created manually from scratch. The editor Octra allows you to correct or create such transcripts.
manual transcription.name: Manual transcription

phonetic detail.description: The phonetic detail editor presents an interactive audio-visual display of the audio signal and the associated words or phonemes. This is useful for interpreting a transcript, e. g. to determine the focus of  a sentence or phrase.
phonetic detail.name: Phonetic detail

speech recognition.description: Speech Recognition will attempt to extract the verbatim content of an audio recording. The result of this process is a text file with a literal transcription of the audio file. NOTE: audio files may be processed by commercial providers who may store and keep the data you send them!
speech recognition.name: Speech Recognition

summarization.description: Summarizes a given full text using AI provided by CLST Radboud University.
summarization.name: Summarization

translation.description: Translates a given transcript to a target language as full text.
translation.name: Translation

upload.description: Drag and drop your audio and optional text files on the web page to upload them to the server for processing. Prior to upload, the format of the audio files will be checked; stereo files will be split into their left and right channel.
upload.name: Upload

word alignment.description: The transcript text is time-aligned with the signal, i. e. for every word in the text we get the appropriate fragment of the audio signal. MAUS generates such a word alignment from the transcript and the audio file.
word alignment.name: Word Alignment

results.last result unavailable: The latest result does not exist anymore.

service remarks.about the result: As soon as the service has finished processing the result appears here.
service remarks.processing time: The processing time depends on the properties of the audio file and the service provider.

add files.description: Drag & drop files (.wav & transcripts) to this whole area (inside the dashed rectangle) or use the "{{addFilesButton}}" button. Later, you can add files via drag & drop to the table rows, too.

check options.description: Now set the options for the added files: Click on the "{{checkOptionsButton}}" button and apply the changed options.

quick start.introduction: The TranscriptionPortal offers two modes for processing audio files: Annotation mode and Summarization & Translation mode. You can switch between the modes by clicking on the tabs at the left top corner.

modes.annotation: In annotation mode you are able to transcribe audio files automatically using ASR, correct the transcript using {{Octra}}, automatically align the transcript into words and edit the phonetic details in {{EmuWebApp}}.
modes.summarization: In summarization mode you automatically transcribe audio files using ASR, check the transcript in {{Octra}}, summarize the transcript using AI and translate it to a selected language automatically.

start processing.description: After all files and options are checked, click on "{{startProcessingButton}}". The application starts the processing of pending tasks.

status bar.errors: {{errors}} tasks failed. For further details please hover over the red "X" icon in a column.
status bar.queued: {{queued}} audio files are waiting for verification.

new update.body: A new update for the TranscriptionPortal is available. Make sure that no automatic processes are running and no tool is opened (Octra, Emu-webApp). Then reload the TranscriptionPortal to install the update.
